name: Odessa Beach Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Odessa in June last year for 11 days and we had a wonderful first holiday together.
reviews.title: Holiday to Remember!!!

reviews.text: The room was very nice, apart from two single beds which was slightly disappointing but other than that we couldn’t fault the room and the bathroom was plenty good enough. But an ant infestation was unwelcome to say the least, but a chat to Jo (Olympic rep) and the management we got moved with no fuss to a different room in which there was no problems.
reviews.title: Improvement from when we visited 3 years ago

reviews.text: Upon the advice we got from another guest, we upgraded to all inclusive for 5 days at €100 each and subsequently the pool and pool bar became our world for those 5days, but with plenty of sunbeds, summer music, the entertainment team where fantastic, water polo, water basketball and great banter! And the glorious weather throughout the holiday…. What more could we ask for!!!
reviews.title: Great all inclusive hotel

reviews.text: The food overall was good, especially dinner!! Always plenty of choice and cooked to perfection! However breakfast and lunch where slightly poor but again, plenty of choice so even the pickiest of eaters shouldn’t go hungry.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once our all inclusive ran out we could venture about a little, there plenty of water sports to do just a walk away from the hotel, we hired a jet ski which was a really fun experience, but Flamingo beach and Fig Tree Bay are both very over crowded and slightly disappointing. The bars on the strip where always full and fun apart England’s departure from the World Cup but was an incredible atmosphere regardless!! The buses run to Ayia Napa frequently and we spent a day at WaterWorld, a night of clubbing in Napa, a lazy day cruise which went from Napa to the Famagusta viewing line and a day at Nissi beach, I would recommend all of them!
reviews.title: We loved our holiday!

reviews.text: Mixed Bag this hotel, Arrived at the hotel at midnight, and checked into our 'twin' room, only to find it was a double, went back to reception, they gave us another room, which was again a double. Third time they got it right, by this time it was 2 o clock. Next day after unpacking we were informed we would have to move rooms, no adequate explanation was given by the manager, except it would be an upgrade.
reviews.title: Thank god for the weather!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was no upgrade, half the hotel is newly furnished the other half is old and wooden, when we complained they said they couldnt move us again, The noise from the hotel we backed onto was horrific, and we had to sleep with the air con on just to smother it out, weeknights it finished at 1 and weekends maybe 3 or 4 in the morning.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.text: Food was ok, breakfast was what you would expect cereals, toast, fry ups. lunch was not up to much chips mainly. And dinner was a mix every night for variety, but the majority of people at from the childrens selection of chips, beans nuggets etc.
reviews.title: would have been spoit if not for lovely pool on next complex

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: pool and sunbathing were spot on as were the cleaning and bar staff. Reception was so so, seemed to understand english when they felt like it.
reviews.title: home from home

reviews.text: room wise, poor television channels, u get bbc 1 and 2 on occaision when the satelite isnt fuzzy, and sometimes bbc world. decor was poor and wooden, coffee making facilites saw there best days in the 1970s.
reviews.title: Excellent - Can't wait to go again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Returned this week from a lovely fortnight at this hotel. We thought it was really good value for money hard to find much fault. Room was a decent size and the beds were super-comfy, had tea and coffee making facilities and a fridge which you dont always get in hotels. Maids did a great job in keeping the room spotless and we were never short of fresh soft towels. We found the food really good there was plenty of choice for all meals one thing we liked was the option to switch dinner for lunch which we did most of the time as we liked going out at night to try some of the many great restaraunts in the vicinity. The only gripe is that it would have been nice to have proper fruit juice at breakfast rather than squash. The location is perfect with the pool terrace giving way to a huge lawn leading down to the beach, getting a sun bed was vever a problem no matter what time you left it to.
reviews.title: Great Holiday at the Odessa

reviews.text: Some places worth a visit to eat/drink- Romeos Tavern (go for the greek night , a great night out) Molti cafe, Raj Curry House, Analtolias , in fact we didn't have a bad meal anywhere. For entertainment try The Ghetto, The Loveboat , Rockafellers. Ripples bar and Fools and horses are great for cocktails too!
reviews.title: Perfect relaxing week!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a perfect week of relaxation! Staff are really helpful and friendly, rooms OK although a little small and could do with an extra cupboard or 2, beds joined together so a bit close for comfort when sharing with a friend as the bedside cabinets are attached to the headboard so you can't move them apart, and a mix up with the beds was quickly sorted. Pool area nice, although towards the end of our stay it was edging towards the 'set your alarm for a sunbed' scenario! Food was fantastic, even for a fussy vegetarian like me, lots of choice and too many gorgeous puddings and cakes! Lots of choice at the bar for All Inclusive, worked our way down the huge cocktail list, bar staff really nice and efficient, Dimitri who serves round the pool bringing your drinks to the sunbed was very funny and couldn't do enough for you. The beach will be much better once the promenade is completed, bit of an obstacle course at the moment. All in all had a great week and will definately be back next year.
reviews.title: definately recommend this hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Odessa for two weeks, at the beginning of May. The food was the best we have had in a number of years, although it could have been a bit hotter, it tasted lovely and always a good selection. Position of hotel was close to beach, bars and shops. The promenade was still in the middle of being redone, but a walk of about 3/4 hour was finished going in the one direction, so it will not be long before the rest is completed. Our only complaint was the lack of entertainment, we were told it was because it was the beginning of the season. The staff were happy, helpfull, especially Demetrius who served us at the pool bar.
reviews.title: Great Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cocktails on the go, great views from our rooms. Food was OK but nothing to dress up for in the evenings. Staff were great and friendly and sociable. Before peaktime was never going to set the pool on fire but it all looked great still.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. Fantastic Staff. Great Holiday.

reviews.text: Our room was quite spacious with a large king size bed and a full size single bed, bath a bit on the small side, wardrobe doors didn't shut very well. Cleaned very well every day (cleaners did leave door open one day which wasn't good).
reviews.title: Fab Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With having a 6 year child we found the entertainment quite adequate at night, it was the start of the season so entertainment team were working on shows which were due to start in the next couple of weeks. We also went out occasionaly as there are many bars surrounding the hotel.
reviews.title: def not if you want to be entertained
Excellent holiday at the Odessa
reviews.text: Daytime entertainment, pilates class, aqua aerobics, pool, darts and table tennis competitions. Kids club twice aday - all the entertainment team were friendly and helpful.

We couldn't fault the bar staff, either in the bar or the pool bar, we found the service to be really efficient and we were all inclusive, and didn't feel we were treated any different to the half board guests.
reviews.title: would not go back at this time of year

reviews.text: The food was fine, probably not as much choice as i've had in hotels in the canaries but it was all nice. My one and only critiscm of the food was that they didn't have a seperate childrens buffet at the evening meal, i really struggled to find something my 6 year old would eat. I got round this by ordering him spaghetti bolognese about 5pm from the pool bar, so when we ate our evening meal he just had his desert.
reviews.title: Could be better

description: The Odessa Beach Hotel enjoys a prime location right in the heart of Protaras and a breath away from one of the best golden sandy beaches of Cyprus, Protaras Bay. The hotel features comfortable guestrooms with contemporary and chic style, an excellent range of facilities and services, spacious public areas with a great choice of restaurants, cafes and bars, and a traditional hospitable atmosphere. From your room balcony you may enjoy the view of the Mediterranean sea with a glass of wine while relaxing. A star choice for families and couples seeking comfort, fun and an enjoyable memorable holiday experience.
